introduction: This video discusses five design patterns in software development: facade pattern (also known as the adapter pattern), bridge pattern, strategy pattern, message passing pattern, and event-driven architecture. The video covers their definitions, visual examples, and potential issues. It emphasizes the importance of using these patterns judiciously and understanding their purpose.

sections.title: Section 1: Facade Pattern (Adapter Pattern)
content: Definition of the facade pattern and its purpose.
Visual example of a Sony mirrorless camera and an analytics abstract interface.
Explanation of the problem with oververticalization and the solution using the strategy pattern.
Discussion on loose coupling between publishers and subscribers using message passing patterns.

sections.title: Section 2: Bridge Pattern
content: Definition of the bridge pattern and its purpose.

Discussion on loose coupling between publishers and subscribers using message passing patterns.

content: Definition of the strategy pattern and its purpose.

sections.title: Section 4: Message Passing Patterns
content: Definition of message passing patterns and their purpose.
